text: Mike watered the flower he will sell yesterday, but he forgot to water the bush.
question: Did Mike forget to water the flowers?

text: Mary called the applicant she will interview yesterday, but there was no answer.
question: Did the applicant answer?

text: James will fix the car he drove tomorrow, but he will need some help.
question: Did James drive a car?

text: Linda will wear the sweater she washed tomorrow, but she won't wear her skirt.
question: Will Linda wear her skirt?

text: The customer complained about the waiter and the chef gave him a free dessert.
question: Did the customer get a free dessert?

text: The woman could not find Bill and his girlfriend became nervous and upset.
question: Could the woman find Bill?

text: Bobby yelled at the teacher and the principal asked his parents for a meeting.
question: Did Bobby yell at the teacher?

text: The teacher praised the girl and her family was proud of her good grades.
question: Was the girl's family proud of her grades?

text: The grandfather of the policewoman who treated himself so badly was troubled.
question: Was the grandfather of the policewoman troubled?

text: The nephew of the maid who cut himself with the knife called the doctor.
question: Did the nephew of the maid call the doctor?

text: The brother of the ballerina who found himself in a lot of trouble phoned home.
question: Did the ballerina phone home?

text: The son of the princess who scratched himself in public was awfully embarrassed.
question: Was the princess embarrassed?

text: Bob will complete the project he started last month, but Fred won't finish his.
question: Will Fred finish his project?

text: John hired the clerk he will promote next month, but he fired another employee.
question: Did John fire an employee?

text: Jim painted the picture he will display next month, but he isn't happy with it.
question: Did Jim paint the picture?

text: Cathy will burn the wood she gathered last week, but she will save some of it.
question: Will Cathy burn all the wood?

text: Mark will answer the email he got last week, but he doesn't know what to write.
question: Will Mark answer the email?

text: Chris cleaned the bookcase he will sell next week, but it is still very dusty.
question: Did Chris clean the bookcase?

text: Susan bought the wine she will drink next week, but she didn't buy any cheese.
question: Did Susan buy any cheese?

text: Amy will visit the man she worked with next month, but she is nervous about it.
question: Is Amy nervous?

text: Paul will marry the woman he just met next month, but the wedding will be small.
question: Will Paul have a small wedding?

text: Dan wrote the speech he will deliver last month, but he hasn't practiced it yet.
question: Has Dan practiced the speech?

text: The witness identified the man, and his wife ran away from the police station.
question: Did the witness run away from the police station?

text: Jenny talked to the reporter, and the photographer took pictures of the scene.
question: Did Jenny talk to the photographer?

text: The robber shot the jeweler, and the salesman reported the crime to the police.
question: Did the robber shoot the jeweler?

text: The journalist criticized Nick, and Sam called the newspaper to complain.
question: Did Sam call the newspaper?

text: The actress yelled at the cameraman, and the director hurried out of the room.
question: Did the cameraman hurry out of the room?

text: Sam hired the plumber, and the carpenter ordered the materials for the house.
question: Did the carpenter order materials?

text: The police arrested the burglar, and his brother phoned a lawyer for help.
question: Was the burglar arrested?

text: The knight greeted the king, and the queen waved to her people at the feast.
question: Did the king wave to people at the feast?

text: The crowd cheered for the model and the designer took a bow after the show.
question: Did the designer take a bow?

text: The juggler entertained the children and their parents drank wine at the party.
question: Did the juggler drink wine?

text: The woman dressed her baby and her son got his clothes from the dresser.
question: Did the women dress her son?

text: Diane hugged her boyfriend and her friend felt uncomfortable watching them.
question: Did Diane's friend feel uncomfortable?

text: Jeff planned the party he will hold last month, but he hasn't sent invitations.
question: Has Jeff send invitations?

text: The niece of the butler who scolded himself for losing the key was very upset.
question: Was the butler very upset?

text: The aunt of the waiter who trained himself to cook wanted to own a restaurant.
question: Did the waiter want to own a restaurant?

text: The sister of the boy who taught himself advanced mathematics was very smart.
question: Was the sister of the boy very smart?

text: The daughter of the king who devoted himself to the kingdom was never emotional.
question: Was the daughter of the king emotional?

text: The niece of the fisherman who got himself a sailboat learned to sail.
question: Did the niece of the fisherman learn to sail?

text: The grandma of the policeman who educated himself at night became a teacher.
question: Did the grandma of the policeman become a teacher?

text: The uncle of the girl who prepared herself for the race was a great athlete.
question: Was the uncle of the girl a great athlete?

text: The nephew of the queen who praised herself all the time was very rude.
question: Was the queen very rude?

text: The sister of the prince who injured herself falling off a roof was still sad.
question: Was the prince sad?

text: The daughter of the actor who hated herself for failing always seemed unhappy.
question: Was the daughter of the actor happy?

text: The sister of the salesman who made a fool of herself at work was very angry.
question: Was the sister of the salesman angry?

text: The daughter of the man who complimented herself in public was beautiful.
question: Was the daughter of the man beautiful?

text: Judy cooked in the kitchen, and Richard barbecued outside in the yard.
question: Did Richard barbecue in the yard?

text: The gardener was happy with the flowers, but the owner of the house was not.
question: Was the owner happy with the flowers?

text: Sarah and her mother had steak, potatoes, and green beans for dinner last night.
question: Did Sarah eat spaghetti and meatballs?

text: Margo will open bakeries in Chicago and New York after getting a loan next year.
question: Will Margo open a bakery in New York?

text: Cindy treated herself to a vacation in China and several other Asian countries.
question: Did Cindy go on a vacation to Africa?

text: The nurse took care of the old lady who could not take care of herself.
question: Could the old lady take care of herself?

text: The pilot will fly a new airplane to Europe and back beginning next week.
question: Will the pilot fly to Europe?

text: Megan got angry with her boss and sued him for discrimination last month.
question: Did the boss sue for discrimination?

text: Kim will display the photos she took last month, but she won't show all of them.
question: Will Kim show all the photos?
